meanings.definition: The state of being idle or inactive.
meanings.sent1: Her idleness during the weekend was spent watching movies.
meanings.sent2: The idleness of the cat was interrupted by the sound of a bird outside.
meanings.sent3: His idleness was so extreme that even the dust bunnies were complaining.
meanings.sent4: The idleness of the old clock made the room feel eerily silent.
meanings.sent5: The idleness of the pond allowed algae to grow unchecked.

meanings.sent1: The garden showed signs of idleness with overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent2: The idleness of the factory led to a decrease in production.
meanings.sent3: The idleness of the playground was a rare sight during recess.
meanings.sent4: The idleness of the bees in winter was a natural part of their life cycle.
meanings.sent5: The idleness of the computer system caused delays in processing orders.

meanings.sent1: The idleness printer needed maintenance to function properly.
meanings.sent2: The idleness machinery in the warehouse was awaiting repairs.
meanings.sent3: The idleness phone lay forgotten in the drawer for months.
meanings.sent4: The idleness car in the garage needed a new battery.
meanings.sent5: The idleness laptop was covered in dust on the shelf.
